page.title: 04Housing
page.content: The property is at the eastern edge of the block, closer into the city of Sheffield, dates from the 1930's although several roads fall into an area known as Fulwood, where the houses are very large, three-story stone properties with slate roofs, dating from the 1880's. These substantial homes are still largely owned by a single family although there is evidence of sub-division into flats and masionettes. Several of the larger properties have been purchased by businesses, notably computer and insurance firms anxious to avoid the high rates of city-centre office blocks. Property built in the 1930's is largely semi-detached and brick built, often without garages, although progression westward leads to the bulk of the residential area which is less than 20 years old.
